I know discussions get heated, but can we refrain from attacking each other like savages? At the end of the day, this _is_  just a game.

More to the point, I believe Sona is in a really bad spot (Understatement of the year). She has been nerfed several times over, even when she wasn't really that good. Personally, I feel she's been given the Evelynn treatment (Purposely nerfed into the abyss until Riot comes up with a rework that they like) because they have stated time and time again how they hate auras and how they hate her ultimate.

Off the top of my head, I cannot think of a match up where Sona has even a slight advantage in (I still do well with her in Gold, but Gold is much, much different than Diamond and above) 

All in all, I feel like Sona is extremely underwhelming (Both playing as her and playing against her) and I just hope Riot doesn't take nearly two years to rework her like they did with Eve.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika310,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nVF6Es62,comment-id=00120000000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2015-10-01T15:32:10.164+0000)

PLEASE READ http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Sona

**AURA: Sona and tagged allied champions receive a shield lasting up to 1.5 seconds.** (W)

AURA: Sona and tagged allied champions deal bonus magic damage on their next basic attack within 3 seconds. (Q)

**AURA: Tagged allied champions gain bonus movement speed for 1.5 seconds.** (E)

Aura is not permanent, it is an aoe buff or debuff, no set time makes it an aura

According to the video game definition of an aura, they are as a matter-of-fact permanent:

> Auras have four basic characteristics:
> 
> *     They are AoE spells, based on the position of the caster, otherwise known as point blank area of effect (PBAoE) spells.
> *     They are instant cast, and have no cooldown.
> *     _**They have an infinite duration, as long as the affected target is within range of the caster, and the caster is alive.**_
> *     They are not dispellable. 

It doesn't matter what Riot wants to call them, common sense and the English definition disagree.
